title.bibl: El Nacional, Mar. 11, 1933. Sociedad Espanola De Chicago in Action Again

div.bibl: El Nacional, Mar. 11, 1933. SOCIEDAD ESPANOLA DE CHICAGO IN ACTION AGAIN

body.p: Sociedad Espanola will give a musical comedy and dance to-day, in the Ballroom of Mirrors located on the fourth floor of the Capitol Building. This affair has been in the process of preparation for sometime and should be highly entertaining. The order of the program is as follows:
La Cocha Micaela - Presented by R. Ondarza.
Chulerias Andaluzas - Dance by N. Vallanta.
Popular Song - By the Morales Sisters.
Mirando a Espana - By Amelia y Nacho.
And other numbers which will more than amuse the crowd.

The dance music will be in charge of "Los Valencians", under the direction of Mr. Juan Pineda. Those responsoble for this affair maintain that it will be the greatest celebration ever given by this Institution.
This same organization has plans on foot for another festival, which will be held about the first of April.
